definition: few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom

sentences.english: They cant change a light bulb or without making a sketch.
sentences.chinese: 他們連燈泡都不會換，或者至少要先畫個草圖。

sentences.english: At least 3 years facility related work experience.
sentences.chinese: 至少3年廠務相關的工作經驗。

sentences.english: All grocery shopping bags contain at least one stick of French bread.
sentences.chinese: 所有超市購物袋裏都裝着至少一根法式長棍麪包。

sentences.english: Allow at least three hours between dinner and bedtime.
sentences.chinese: 晚餐和睡覺之間至少允許有三個小時。

sentences.english: but at least it got the juices flowing.
He suggested them read at least one book on the legal rights.
sentences.chinese: 他建議他們至少閱讀一本關於法定權利的書。

sentences.english: What did they do? Please give at least two examples.
sentences.chinese: 他們做了什麼？請至少舉出兩個例子。

sentences.english: Or, at least some prominent figures think so.
sentences.chinese: 至少某些知名人士是這樣認爲的。

sentences.english: Delaying reimplantation till at least 6 months after resection.
sentences.chinese: 再次植入應在切除術後至少6個月。

sentences.english: It is well-known that lung cancer is caused at least in part by smoking too much.
sentences.chinese: 衆所周知，肺癌至少部分是由於吸菸過多引起的。

sentences.english: Perhaps we all knew - or, at least, imagined - that it would be this way.
sentences.chinese: 或許我們都知道，或者至少可以想象他可能是這樣的。

sentences.english: Each family possesses at least three milk cows.
Now Russia, for at least the second time, has fired on a Chinese civilian ship.
sentences.chinese: 現在俄羅斯，至少第二次，解僱了在中國民用船。

sentences.english: But that isn't something worth celebrating, at least not for Chinese mayors.
sentences.chinese: 可惜這並不值得慶祝，至少對於中國的市長們是如此。

sentences.english: During the depression, I used to hop freights at least once a month.
sentences.chinese: 大蕭條時期，我一月至少一次要偷偷搭乘貨運列車。

definition: at the minimum/at the very least
that level or higher/that amount or more/the above-mentioned/(used to indicate that one has completed one's remarks) That is all.
